message.content:
{"id": "49890", "title": "Bug 49890: Nio Selector issue on Linux platform", "description": "Bug 49890: Nio Selector issue on Linux platform
Created attachment 25997: NioEndpoint.java and simple web application

Sometimes, the server's CPU reaches 100% and stays at 100% until the server is restarted. This issue has been reproduced with Java versions 1.6.007, 1.6.018, and 1.6.021.

It seems to be a duplicate of issue Bug 46373. It appears that the Jetty team has fixed that problem (http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel).

I have added some logging to the NioEndpoint.java file.", "OB": "The bug report does not provide sufficient information about the specific problem with the Nio selector on the Linux platform. It is also unclear what triggers the CPU usage to reach 100%.", "EB": "To reproduce the JVM bug, we should perform several requests to the web application and observe the CPU usage. It is suggested to press F5 in the browser and hold the button.", "SR": "This issue has not been observed on the Windows platform. Please find the following attachments:
- NioEndpoint.7z: patched NioEndpoint.java file (with added logging)
- web.7z: simple web application"}

origin.input_prompt:
Your role is a senior software engineer, you are very good at analyzing and writing bug reports.
It is possible that the bug report may lack sufficient details in the OB, EB, and SR sections.  In such cases, your task is to infer the appropriate details based on the context and supplement the bug report to ensure it contains clear and complete OB/EB/SR statements.  Also, improve the wording of these statements for clarity where possible.
To facilitate this process, please provide your responses in JSON format as follows:
{"id": "", "title": "", "description": "", "OB": "", "EB": "", "SR": ""}
origin.input_content:
<BUG REPORT>
{'id': '49890', 'title': 'Bug 49890Nio Selector issue on linux platform', 'description': "Bug 49890Nio Selector issue on linux platform Created attachment 25997 [details]NioEndpoint.java and simple web applicationsometimes ,server's cpu reaches 100%,and keep 100% all the time,until restartthe server.Reproduced with java versions: 1.6.007,1.6.018, 1.6.021.It is duplicate of issue: Bug 46373.It seams that Jetty guys fixed that problem: http://jira.codehaus.org/browse/JETTY937?focusedCommentId=168060&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:commenttabpanel.I added some logging to NioEndpoint.java. ", 'OB': '', 'EB': 'To reproduce jvm bug we should do several requests(we can just press F5 in browser and hold button) to web application. ', 'SR': 'And it is never reproduced on windows platform.In the attach:NioEndpoint.7zpatched NioEndpoint.java (with logging)web.7zsimple web application. '}
